reviews.review:
Machmaking is a tragedy, you can wait more than twenty minutes and suddenly realize that only one of three people have joined. I really like this game, but most of the time I have to watch the lobby screen and not play, which is very frustrating and takes all the pleasure away. 

The biggest problem is that the developer hasn't solved these bugs for years. It just doesn't feel right for the fans of the game. I would really like it to finally change, because from the gameplay side, it's one of the best productions to play with your friends.

for all the bugs and problems that this game has and it has more than you would expect for a game that squeezes you for transactions more than a FTP game  its still amazing. its basically hide and seek tag but for adults with a few twists, perks and items. Honestly if you like asymetric games and playing with people i highly recommend it. Whoever you are this game has something for you survivor side or killer side.

i love this game, i honestly think this is a great horror game, and people who start on this game will love it, i love how you can design your character in the shop, you can have perks and they can be very usefull

Uma delisia.
Jugalo con amigos y no te vas a arrepentir, a veces el tiempo de espera y el matchmaking te trolean un poco pero despues de 4 a√±os sigue siendo un juegazo.

When i first got the game i genuinely loved the idea of asymmetrical horror, but over the past 100 hours or so it got old really fast. the community is extremely toxic on both ends and it seems the only way to win is to play killers that counter everything or play in a SWF (survive with friends). That being said, there is always the option of custom matches for a source of pure entertainment if you dont like the community and their wicked ideals

Honestamente yo este juego yo lo amaba pero en cuanto metieron el MMR el juego se volvi√≥ tedioso y estresante jugar ya que no puede usar otros killer porque te hacen gen rush, el lado de los survivors se volvi√≥ ventajoso para ellos, si metieron el MMR debi√≥ ser en un modo ranked no en publicas, asi que si tienes pensado comprar dbd de killer mejor espera porque esta super des balanceado el juego actualmente
What I like about the game is how you have to work together as a team to escape the killer. It is also good for jump scares when the killer is in pursuit with you in a chase.
legal, mas injusto <3, tem mto bug tbm.
cara e muito divertido o jogo

Pretty fun and they (being the developers) do a good job at making you actually WANT to come back to the game, there's some minor flaws with the game for sure, but the overall playability of the game as well as the fun you can have with your friends is dope. ALSO the team is constantly looking for new content to add to the game and that's super rare nowadays, the game has an amazing horror aspect too, my friends and I have been caught screaming once or twice from being scared from the atmosphere and the tension that naturally rises from playing. Overall a really good horror game that puts a great emphasis on actual Horror elements and teamwork.
this game is super fun!!! and even more fun with friends

gostei da jogabilidade e da historia a gameplay tem alguns bugs vez ou outra mas n atrapalha tanto, agora eu imploro buffa o the legion pelo amor de deus ele merece um buff

√â um jogo muito divertido para jogar com os amigos. Por ser um jogo que n√£o tem uma call, isso prejudica a jogabilidade caso voc√™ esteja sozinho. √â uma √≥tima op√ß√£o para quem gosta de jogos de terror.

I'm taking time to write this review since I've been banned from playing for an hour because the server dropped me at the end of a match.  The reason my ban is so high is because a few days ago the server dropped me from 3 matches.  I have never purposely dc'd in my life.

The game knows I didn't DC, it still gives me my points, but bans me from playing because fuck me, right?  I deserve to be punished since the game barely functions.  

Reminds me of how the game de-pips my ranking when ANOTHER player DC's.  The is a horror of a game, but not in the way you think.

I would be an a**hole if I recommended this game to anyone.

But I'm still gonna, because it's awesome.  The bugs are many and are usually just ignored.  You can buy DLC that barely functions and it might get fixed in a few months.  Some never get fixed.  Matchmaking is terrible, the survivor community is entitled and embraces toxicity.

But it's so much fun killing them.  Survivors will taunt you for no reason, they'll dance around like they won even when you win, they'll berate you after game no matter what.

But you can kill them.  Killing people who annoy me is so much fun.  Being the killer is so much fun.  There's no game like DBD.  Even at my angriest and most frustrated, I come back and as soon as I start killing I remember why it's worth it.

So I would recommend this game.

it good but needs more upgrades

This is one of the most unique games I have ever played and I can't even compare it to anything else. This game can be a lot of fun but only if you're willing to get really into it. Their is a lot to know and if you plan on not investing a good chunk of time on the game then I would stay away. With that being said I think that every match plays out differently and there is always something new that happens. Their is a bit of a learning curve but its not terrible

It's really unique and has an amazing writing team who consistently add new killers and survivors with unique abilities. The developers on the other hand are not as amazing, they consistently make choices that make the game more survivor sided and choose not to Nerf obviously broken perks and items while choosing to Nerf things that are balanced and fine to play against.

The cosmetic system is not great but as long as you don't care what you look like it doesn't really matter.

I highly recommend this game as long as you are willing to put in the hours to make it worth it.

I've played a lot of Dead By Daylight recently and it's cemented itself as a staple of my gaming time over the last several months. 
Asymmetric PvP pitting a Killer vs Survivors is an interesting premise, but the more I dive into it the more I appreciate it as a game in a way I haven't since Team Fortress 2. There's tons of small design decisions that help or hinder each team and create a really engaging game. Killers play very differently from survivors, and each killer offers a unique ability that shapes their gameplay. There are 66-72 perks available per side, which also keeps things fresh.

Things that stand out:
The game itself is unlike anything else out there. The way that chases, powers, and the tools each side has is incredibly interesting and refreshing. Shorter matches also keep things from getting too crazy, and the progression keeps me interested.

The way each character (both killer and survivor) starts with 3 unique perks that after leveling that character up will become available to others. This not only shapes an initial new playstyle that can be iteratively customized, but also incentives players to try a bunch of characters and add their tools to everyone's collection. The killers themselves provide a wide variety of playstyles, so it becomes much harder to burn out on the game. Daily quests (Rituals) and seasonal challenges (Tomes) also encourage playing different characters for bonus currency, and the Tomes provide a sort of meta progression that also unlocks lore and feeds into a Battlepass.

I know progression is a stickler for may people, so I'd like to take some time to talk about it. To me it's a system that does not abuse the player, but provides a lot of reward for playing the game. Each match awards Blood Points, which are used to unlock new consumable items, perks, and otherwise progress the level of each character. There's some randomized elements to what's available at each bloodweb, but there's lots of player choice here.

Blood Points are fantastic for two reasons. 
First, players want and need them to unlock new tools and provide a great sense of forward progress even if you feel like you're not playing well, and they are usable across all characters (so you can unlock on one while playing on another).
Secondly, they're awarded not for "winning" but for completing certain actions (with some caps). This means that often times a quick match and toxic behavior will result in lower points for both sides. It's a fantastic tool for the developers to incentivise behavior that makes for the most compelling experience for both sides. (They've worked it into fiction too, but that's another topic). Also, they award points if there's a quitter in your match to mollify it a bit.

All in all, it's a fantastic game and I'm excited to see who gets added next.

Ive been playing dead by daylight on almost every system, Switch, Xboxone, and Ps4, And my reviews are the same even with PC

POSITIVES
* Its fun when your bored and want a couple of quick matches
* They are constantly updating the game with new Quirks
* Multiple Different Killers to Play
* It is simple and easy to figure out the controls, not alot of thought process involved to playing
* If you enjoy something that makes your heart pound this is the game cause the difficulty to hide, sneak, run, from one killer is the challenge 
* playing with friends is alot more fun then alone, and since its multiplayer you have the option to do so.
* You can customize your killer and player which is always a positve
* Graphics are decent 

NEGATIVES
* The price point i feel is a little too high especially when they make DLCs every 3 months
* The Killers is what makes the game honestly, If they are horrible , The game will be horrible, Same with Team mates So have to have an Equal balance
* Like all online games Depending on other peoples connection depends on how your game is ran.
* They need to make more maps, plain and simple


This is Just my opinion some people might have a different view and thats okay :) I still think this is a great game to play.
